title: Drawing, "Design for a pendant", 1775
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, gold on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Hanging from a cord which is fastened by an agraffe; a blue diamond framed by an interlaced band composed of white diamonds. The pendant is a cross composed of five blue diamonds each, framed by two entwined oval bands. In the corners are rays.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a pendant", 1775.
1775. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, gold on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-785.
